parse.title: List of things named after Kim Il-sung

text.*:
Kimilsungia is the namesake flower of Kim Il-sung.

Kim Il-sung was the founder and first leader of North Korea. Jane Portal, the author of Art Under Control in North Korea, assesses that: "[i]t is probably the case that Kim Il-sung [had] more buildings named after him during his lifetime than any other leader in history".[1] North Korea claims that "[m]ore than 480 streets, institutions and organizations in 100 countries were named after Kim Il Sung".[2] Since Kim Il-sung's name Il-sung can mean "the Sun", many things named after him are actually called this way.[3]

Contents

  • 1 List
    • 1.1 Schools
    • 1.2 Museums
    • 1.3 Streets, squares and parks
    • 1.4 Awards
    • 1.5 Other
    • 1.6 Named after the Sun
    • 1.7 Proposed namings
  • 2 See also
  • 3 References
    • 3.1 Works cited

List[edit]

This is a dynamic list and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by expanding it with reliably sourced entries.

Schools[edit]

  • Kim Il-sung College for Physics[4] – located in Pochon County, Ryanggang Province and named to commemorate the 1937 Battle of Pochonbo[5]
  • Kim Il-sung Military University[4] – school for selected commissioned officers.[5]
  • Kim Il-sung University – called that since it opened in 1946[6]
  • Kim Il-sung University of Politics[7]
  • Kim Il-sung Open University[4]
  • Kim Il-sung Higher Party School[4] – the country's top school for the selected few[5]
  • Kim Il-sung Research Institute of Agricultural Science – in Guinea[8]
  • "Kim Il-sung Research Institute" – generic name for classrooms in large elementary schools dedicated to studying Kim Il-sung[9]

Museums[edit]

  • South Hamgyong Museum of the Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Il-sung – in Hamhung, South Hamgyong Province[10]
  • Sinuiju Museum of the Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Il-sung – in Sinuiju, North Pyongan Province[11]
  • South Pyongan Museum of the Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Il-sung – in Pyongsong, South Pyongan Province[12]
  • Kim Il-sung Revolutionary Museum – in Chongjin[13]
  • Chagang Provincial Comrade Kim Il-sung Revolutionary Museum – in Chagang Province[14]
  • Museum of President Kim Il-sung's Revolutionary Activities – in Wonsan, Kangwon Province[15]
  • Museum of President Kim Il-sung's Revolutionary Activities – in Ryanggang Province[16]

Streets, squares and parks[edit]

"Kim Il Sung Lane" in Damascus is one of as many as 450 streets around the world named after the North Korean president.
  • Several streets in foreign countries.[17] North Korea claims 450 in 100 countries.[18] There is a "Kim Il-sung Street" or equivalent in:
    • Hamhung, North Korea[19]
    • Maputo, Mozambique[20]
    • Phnom Penh, Cambodia[21]
    • Damascus, Syria[22]
  • Kim Il-sung Square, Pyongyang, North Korea[23]
  • Kim Il-sung Park in Damascus, Syria. Inaugurated in 2015.[22]

Awards[edit]

  • Kim Il-sung Award[4]
  • Kim Il-sung Medal[4]
  • Kim Il-sung Prize[24]
  • International Kim Il-sung Prize[25]
  • Order of Kim Il-sung[26]
  • Kim Il-sung Youth Honor Prize[26]
  • Kim Il-sung Children Honor Prize[26]

Other[edit]

A plaque dedicated to "Kimilsungism" at the Juche Tower
  • Kimilsungia – an orchid presented to Kim Il-sung by Indonesia's leader Sukarno in 1965 and named after Kim when introduced to North Korea in 1977[27]
  • Kim Il-sung Stadium – formerly Pyongyang Municipal Stadium[28]
  • Kim Il-sung Socialist Youth League – named by Kim Jong-il in 1996 after Kim Il-sung's death two years earlier[29]
  • "Kimilsungism" – The Juche idea was officially named "Kimilsungism" in 1974[30]
  • "Song of General Kim Il-sung" – composed by Kim Won-gyun in 1946,[31] its lyrics are carved in stones across the country[32]
  • "Kim Il-sung Constitution" – name of the 1998 constitution,[4] that made Kim Il-sung the Eternal President of the country after his death[33]

Named after the Sun[edit]

  • Day of the Sun – designated in 1997 after a three-year mourning period following the death of Kim Il-sung[27]
  • Kumsusan Palace of the Sun[3]

Proposed namings[edit]

  • "Kim Il-sung City" – proposed name for Pyongyang after Kim Il-sung's death. Another proposal was to name Pyongyang "Kim Jong-il City" and name Seoul "Kim Il-sung City" once reunification would be attained.[34]

  • Society portal
  • Kim Il-sung bibliography
